| Proposed | *   [Resettlement of the Gaza Strip](/wiki/Proposed_Israeli_resettlement_of_the_Gaza_Strip "Proposed Israeli resettlement of the Gaza Strip")<br>    <br>*   [West Bank annexation](/wiki/Proposed_Israeli_annexation_of_the_West_Bank "Proposed Israeli annexation of the West Bank")<br>    <br>*   [Jordan Valley annexation](/wiki/Annexation_of_the_Jordan_Valley "Annexation of the Jordan Valley") |

On 1 October 2024, [Israel](/wiki/Israel "Israel")
 invaded [Southern Lebanon](/wiki/Southern_Lebanon "Southern Lebanon")
, marking the sixth [Israeli invasion of Lebanon](/wiki/Israeli%E2%80%93Lebanese_conflict "Israeli–Lebanese conflict")
 since 1978.[\[81\]](#cite_note-87)
 The invasion took place after nearly 12 months of [conflict](/wiki/Israel%E2%80%93Hezbollah_conflict_(2023%E2%80%93present) "Israel–Hezbollah conflict (2023–present)")
 between Israel and [Hezbollah](/wiki/Hezbollah "Hezbollah")
. Israel did not fully withdraw by the new deadline, as it withdrew troops from Lebanese villages but kept Israeli forces maintaining five military outposts on highlands in Southern Lebanon.

Background
----------

Main articles: [Gaza war](/wiki/Gaza_war "Gaza war")
, [Israel–Hezbollah conflict (2023–2024)](/wiki/Israel%E2%80%93Hezbollah_conflict_(2023%E2%80%932024) "Israel–Hezbollah conflict (2023–2024)")
, [2024 Lebanon electronic device attacks](/wiki/2024_Lebanon_electronic_device_attacks "2024 Lebanon electronic device attacks")
, [20 September 2024 Beirut attack](/wiki/20_September_2024_Beirut_attack "20 September 2024 Beirut attack")
, [September 2024 Israeli attacks against Lebanon](/wiki/September_2024_Israeli_attacks_against_Lebanon "September 2024 Israeli attacks against Lebanon")
, and [2024 Hezbollah headquarters strike](/wiki/2024_Hezbollah_headquarters_strike "2024 Hezbollah headquarters strike")

The last time Israel invaded southern Lebanon and engaged in ground combat with Hezbollah was during the month-long [2006 Lebanon War](/wiki/2006_Lebanon_War "2006 Lebanon War")
.[\[94\]](#cite_note-apnews20240930-100)

According to security expert Sobelman, Israel had spent two decades preparing for the next war with Hezbollah.[\[95\]](#cite_note-cnn20241012-101)

Shortly after the onset of the [Gaza war](/wiki/Gaza_war "Gaza war")
 in October 2023, Hezbollah joined the conflict, citing solidarity with Palestinians,[\[96\]](#cite_note-aj-102)
 which quickly escalated into regular cross-border military exchanges impacting areas in or around [northern Israel](/wiki/Northern_Israel "Northern Israel")
, [southern Lebanon](/wiki/Southern_Lebanon "Southern Lebanon")
 and the Israeli-occupied [Golan Heights](/wiki/Golan_Heights "Golan Heights")
 of [Syria](/wiki/Syria "Syria")
.[\[97\]](#cite_note-103)
 Hezbollah said it aimed to pressure Israel by forcing it to fight on two fronts.[\[89\]](#cite_note-foreignaffairs20240923-95)
 Hezbollah has offered an immediate ceasefire should [a ceasefire also happen in Gaza](/wiki/Calls_for_a_ceasefire_during_the_Gaza_war "Calls for a ceasefire during the Gaza war")
.[\[98\]](#cite_note-Hezbollah_warns-104)
[\[99\]](#cite_note-105)
 From 8 October 2023 to 20 September 2024, Hezbollah has launched 1,900 cross border attacks, and Israel has launched another 8,300.[\[100\]](#cite_note-aljazeera20240925-106)
 The fighting killed 564 in Lebanon (including 133 civilians),[\[101\]](#cite_note-leb-displace-107)
 and 52 in Israel (including 27 civilians), displaced entire communities in Israel and Lebanon,[\[101\]](#cite_note-leb-displace-107)
 with significant damage to civilian infrastructure.[\[102\]](#cite_note-108)

Israel requested that Hezbollah implement [United Nations Security Council Resolution 1701](/wiki/United_Nations_Security_Council_Resolution_1701 "United Nations Security Council Resolution 1701")
 (UNSCR 1701) and withdraw its forces north of the [Litani River](/wiki/Litani_River "Litani River")
.[\[103\]](#cite_note-UNSCcondemn-109)
[\[104\]](#cite_note-110)
 Hezbollah has stated it will continue attacking Israel until Israel halts [its operations in Gaza](/wiki/Gaza_war "Gaza war")
.[\[105\]](#cite_note-aljazeera20240916-111)
 Both Israel and Hezbollah have outstanding obligations under UNSCR 1701.[\[106\]](#cite_note-112)
[\[103\]](#cite_note-UNSCcondemn-109)
[\[107\]](#cite_note-securitycouncilreport20230713-113)
 Hezbollah has established strong military presence in southern Lebanon, storing rockets in civilian sites, building tunnels into Israel, and obstructing [United Nations Interim Force in Lebanon](/wiki/United_Nations_Interim_Force_in_Lebanon "United Nations Interim Force in Lebanon")
's (UNIFIL) access.[\[108\]](#cite_note-Vohra2-114)
[\[109\]](#cite_note-nytimes20241001-115)
 Israel continues to occupy Ghajar and an adjacent area,[\[107\]](#cite_note-securitycouncilreport20230713-113)
[\[110\]](#cite_note-116)
 and has repeatedly breached Lebanese airspace, waters, and borders.[\[111\]](#cite_note-117)
[\[112\]](#cite_note-118)
[\[113\]](#cite_note-119)
 UNIFIL reports that Israel entered Lebanese airspace on more than 22,000 occasions between 2007 and 2021.[\[114\]](#cite_note-120)
[\[115\]](#cite_note-121)
 Diplomatic efforts, led by U.S. The IDF said that they were distributed without senior authorisation and that the incident was being investigated.[\[118\]](#cite_note-124)

On 17 and 18 September, thousands of Hezbollah's handheld [pagers and walkie-talkies exploded](/wiki/2024_Lebanon_electronic_device_attacks "2024 Lebanon electronic device attacks")
 in a coordinated series of attacks.[\[119\]](#cite_note-CNN-3-125)
 The explosions killed 42 people and injured at least 3,500, including civilians.[\[120\]](#cite_note-126)
[\[121\]](#cite_note-NWS_1-127)
[\[122\]](#cite_note-ABCN_1-128)
 Reuters reported that, according to an unnamed Hezbollah official, 1,500 Hezbollah fighters were taken out of action due to injuries, with many blinded or having lost their hands.[\[123\]](#cite_note-129)
 Despite Israel denying involvement with the attack,[\[124\]](#cite_note-denial-130)
 unnamed Israeli sources told Reuters and other media that it was orchestrated by Israel's intelligence service ([Mossad](/wiki/Mossad "Mossad")
) and military.[\[125\]](#cite_note-131)
[\[126\]](#cite_note-nyt-fbs-trojan-24-132)
[\[119\]](#cite_note-CNN-3-125)
 In response, Hezbollah, who described the attack as a possible [declaration of war](/wiki/Declaration_of_war "Declaration of war")
 by Israel, launched a rocket attack on northern Israel a few days later.[\[127\]](#cite_note-Reuters-2-133)
[\[128\]](#cite_note-134)

On 20 September, tensions further rose after [Ibrahim Aqil](/wiki/Ibrahim_Aqil "Ibrahim Aqil")
 [was killed in an Israeli strike](/wiki/20_September_2024_Beirut_attack "20 September 2024 Beirut attack")
 in [Beirut](/wiki/Beirut "Beirut")
, along with other senior commanders from the unit.[\[129\]](#cite_note-135)
[\[130\]](#cite_note-136)

People in southern Lebanon and Beirut received mobile phone calls and messages that told them to relocate.[\[131\]](#cite_note-137)
 IDF spokesperson Daniel Hagari said in a video address, "We advise civilians from Lebanese villages located in and next to buildings and areas used by Hezbollah for military purposes, such as those used to store weapons, to immediately evacuate for their own safety".[\[132\]](#cite_note-138)

The IDF [began a series of airstrikes on 23 September](/wiki/September_2024_Israeli_attacks_against_Lebanon "September 2024 Israeli attacks against Lebanon")
, killing over 800 and injuring more than 5,000 in the first week.[\[133\]](#cite_note-NYTimesInfo-139)
[\[134\]](#cite_note-140)
\[_[failed verification](/wiki/Wikipedia:Verifiability "Wikipedia:Verifiability")\
_\]

On 27 September 2024, [Hassan Nasrallah](/wiki/Hassan_Nasrallah "Hassan Nasrallah")
, the [secretary-general of Hezbollah](/wiki/Secretary-General_of_Hezbollah "Secretary-General of Hezbollah")
, and several other senior Hezbollah leaders, including [Ali Karaki](/wiki/Ali_Karaki "Ali Karaki")
, commander of Hezbollah's southern front, were killed in an [Israeli airstrike](/wiki/2024_Hezbollah_headquarters_strike "2024 Hezbollah headquarters strike")
 in [Beirut](/wiki/Beirut "Beirut")
.[\[135\]](#cite_note-141)
[\[87\]](#cite_note-apnews20240928-93)
 The strike took place while Hezbollah leaders were meeting at a [headquarters](/wiki/Hezbollah_Headquarters "Hezbollah Headquarters")
 located underground beneath residential buildings in [Haret Hreik](/wiki/Haret_Hreik "Haret Hreik")
 in the [Dahieh](/wiki/Dahieh "Dahieh")
 suburb to the south of Beirut.[\[87\]](#cite_note-apnews20240928-93)
[\[136\]](#cite_note-Haaretz-142)

### Previous Israeli raids

On 1 October, the IDF revealed that its special forces had carried out more than 70 small covert raids into southern Lebanon since November 2023, but had not clashed with Hezbollah fighters during these raids.[\[137\]](#cite_note-143)
 The IDF said it had uncovered Hezbollah tunnels, weaponry, and invasion plans in villages near the border, including [Ayta ash-Shaab](/wiki/Ayta_ash-Shaab "Ayta ash-Shaab")
, [Mais al-Jabal](/wiki/Mais_al-Jabal "Mais al-Jabal")
 and [Kfar Kila](/wiki/Kfar_Kila,_Marjayoun "Kfar Kila, Marjayoun")
.[\[138\]](#cite_note-jpost_1oct-144)
 IDF Spokesman [Daniel Hagari](/wiki/Daniel_Hagari "Daniel Hagari")
 said they found Hezbollah plans to launch an attack similar to Hamas' [7 October attacks](/wiki/October_7_attacks "October 7 attacks")
, which sparked the conflict.[\[86\]](#cite_note-reuters20240930-92)
 Hagari also mentioned that evidence from these operations, including videos and maps, would be presented to the international community. Two hours later, the IDF fired rounds into the camp that caused smoke to rise, injuring 15 UNIFIL peacekeepers due to skin irritations and [gastrointestinal](/wiki/Gastrointestinal_tract "Gastrointestinal tract")
 reactions.[\[74\]](#cite_note-bbc20241013-79)
 A report by one of the countries providing troops to UNIFIL said that the smoke was suspected to be [white phosphorus](/wiki/White_phosphorus "White phosphorus")
, the use of which is unlawful in populated areas under international law.[\[280\]](#cite_note-286)

#### Drone attack on IDF base

Main article: [2024 Hezbollah drone strike on Binyamina](/wiki/2024_Hezbollah_drone_strike_on_Binyamina "2024 Hezbollah drone strike on Binyamina")

A Hezbollah drone attack on a gathering of IDF soldiers in Zar'it barracks in [Binyamina](/wiki/Binyamina-Giv%27at_Ada "Binyamina-Giv'at Ada")
 killed at least four Israeli soldiers and wounded another 61.[\[281\]](#cite_note-287)
[\[282\]](#cite_note-IDFbaseattack-288)

### 14 October

#### Aitou airstrike

Main article: [October 2024 Aitou airstrike](/wiki/October_2024_Aitou_airstrike "October 2024 Aitou airstrike")

An Israeli airstrike hit the [Maronite Christian](/wiki/Lebanese_Maronite_Christians "Lebanese Maronite Christians")
 town of [Aitou](/wiki/Aitou "Aitou")
 in northern Lebanon, killing at least 21 and wounding eight.[\[283\]](#cite_note-289)
 The dead included including twelve women and two children and injured eight others.[\[284\]](#cite_note-290)
[\[285\]](#cite_note-291)
[\[286\]](#cite_note-292)

### 15 October

On 15 October, the [UNHCR](/wiki/UNHCR "UNHCR")
 said that over 25% of Lebanon was under evacuation orders of Israel.[\[287\]](#cite_note-293)
 Israeli air strikes in [Qana](/wiki/Qana "Qana")
 killed 15 people and injured 15 others.[\[288\]](#cite_note-294)

The French Armed Forces Minister [Sébastien Lecornu](/wiki/S%C3%A9bastien_Lecornu "Sébastien Lecornu")
 stated he supported UNIFIL remaining in place in Lebanon, despite Israel's orders for them to leave.[\[289\]](#cite_note-295)

#### Israeli strikes

Israel bombed homes and a healthcare center in [Qana](/wiki/Qana "Qana")
, which is notable for having previously experienced massacres in [1996](/wiki/Qana_massacre "Qana massacre")
 and [2006](/wiki/2006_Qana_airstrike "2006 Qana airstrike")
. Netanyahu was not in the residence at the time, and no casualties were reported.[\[303\]](#cite_note-309)
 In response, Netanyahu stated that "the proxies of Iran who today tried to assassinate me and my wife made a bitter mistake."[\[304\]](#cite_note-310)
 Iran has attributed the reported attack to Hezbollah, with the state-run [IRNA news agency](/wiki/Islamic_Republic_News_Agency "Islamic Republic News Agency")
 quoting Iran's mission to the UN saying: "The action in question has been carried out by Hezbollah in Lebanon."[\[305\]](#cite_note-311)

### 20 October

#### Destruction of observation tower in Marwahin

UNIFIL released a press statement stating that the IDF deliberately bulldozed a UNIFIL observation tower and perimeter fence in the Lebanese border town of [Marwahin](/wiki/Marwahin "Marwahin")
.[\[306\]](#cite_note-312)

#### IDF strike on LAF soldiers

An IDF airstrike killed three LAF soldiers driving in a vehicle near an IDF area of operation.[\[307\]](#cite_note-313)
[\[308\]](#cite_note-314)

#### Hezbollah rocket attack

[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/da/120132_mushrooms_are_intercepted_at_the_border_in_the_nor_PikiWiki_Israel.jpg/250px-120132_mushrooms_are_intercepted_at_the_border_in_the_nor_PikiWiki_Israel.jpg)](/wiki/File:120132_mushrooms_are_intercepted_at_the_border_in_the_nor_PikiWiki_Israel.jpg)

Interception of missiles over northern Israel

About 200 missiles were fired at northern Israel.[\[309\]](#cite_note-315)
[\[310\]](#cite_note-316)

### 21 October

A bomb hit a residential building across the street from the Rafik Hariri University hospital, killing at least 18, including four children, and injuring 60.[\[311\]](#cite_note-cnn20241102-317)

#### Clashes

Hezbollah and the IDF engaged in clashes in the villages of [Ayta ash Shab](/wiki/Ayta_ash_Shab "Ayta ash Shab")
 and Ramiya as the IDF attempted to advance into the villages.[\[312\]](#cite_note-318)

### 22 October

An Israeli airstrike on a house in [Teffahta](/w/index.php?title=Teffahta&action=edit&redlink=1 "Teffahta (page does not exist)")
 killed 19 people.[\[313\]](#cite_note-319)

#### Hezbollah rocket barrage

Hezbollah conducted a rocket barrage on [Neot Mordechai](/wiki/Neot_Mordechai "Neot Mordechai")
 in northern Israel, a 27-year-old IDF reservist from Tel Aviv was killed and three other soldiers were seriously wounded.[\[314\]](#cite_note-320)
 Another soldier was killed in south Lebanon.[\[53\]](#cite_note-IDFlossesgov-57)

### 23 October

Air attacks on Dahieh resumed in what was called one of the worst nights of bombing in the neighborhood to date. Two were employees of [Al Mayadeen](/wiki/Al_Mayadeen "Al Mayadeen")
, and the other worked for [Al Manar TV](/wiki/Al-Manar "Al-Manar")
.[\[319\]](#cite_note-325)

### 26 October

The IDF said five of its soldiers were killed in southern Lebanon,[\[53\]](#cite_note-IDFlossesgov-57)
 bringing the IDF's reported casualties up to 32 since 1 October, according to [CNN](/wiki/CNN "CNN")
.[\[320\]](#cite_note-cnn20241027-326)

#### IDF attack on UNIFIL observation post near Dhayra on 22 October

A UNIFIL press release on 25 October stated that IDF soldiers fired at an observation post near the town of [Dhayra](/w/index.php?title=Dhayra&action=edit&redlink=1 "Dhayra (page does not exist)")
 on 22 October 2024.[\[321\]](#cite_note-327)
[\[322\]](#cite_note-328)

### 27 October

At least eight people were killed and 25 wounded in an Israeli strike on the Haret Saida neighoorhood of Sidon.[\[320\]](#cite_note-cnn20241027-326)

### 28 October

#### Beqaa Valley airstrikes

Main article: [2024 Beqaa Valley airstrikes](/wiki/2024_Beqaa_Valley_airstrikes "2024 Beqaa Valley airstrikes")

The Lebanese Health Ministry reported that at least 60 people,[\[323\]](#cite_note-theguardian20241104-329)
 including two children, were killed and 58 wounded in strikes on 12 areas of the [Beqaa Valley](/wiki/Beqaa_Valley "Beqaa Valley")
. This has resulted in the deaths of at least 208 health care workers, and 311 other injuries.[\[420\]](#cite_note-426)
 Targeting health establishments and units, including hospitals and their medical staff, is [illegal under international humanitarian law](/wiki/First_Geneva_Convention "First Geneva Convention")
.[\[421\]](#cite_note-427)
 Human Rights Watch states that it has documented three Israeli attacks on Lebanese medical workers and healthcare facilities and refers to the attacks as "apparent war crimes."[\[422\]](#cite_note-428)

Israel justified the strikes as targeting Hezbollah bunkers beneath the hospitals,[\[423\]](#cite_note-429)
 as medical facilities lose protections when they are used for militant activity.

#### Attacks on civilian Hezbollah targets

In October 2024, Israel bombed financial institutions it stated were affiliated with Hezbollah, leading [Amnesty International](/wiki/Amnesty_International "Amnesty International")
 to state the strikes should be investigated as possible war crimes.[\[424\]](#cite_note-430)

#### Attacks on journalists

[Reporters without Borders](/wiki/Reporters_without_Borders "Reporters without Borders")
 called for an independent investigation into a "possible war crime" in response to an Israeli airstrike that hit a guesthouse in the town of [Hasbaya](/wiki/Hasbaya "Hasbaya")
 killing and injuring several journalists.[\[425\]](#cite_note-431)

#### Attacks on UNIFIL positions

In October 2024, Israel attacked the [UNIFIL peacekeeping bases](/wiki/United_Nations_Interim_Force_in_Lebanon#Attacks_on_UNIFIL_bases "United Nations Interim Force in Lebanon")
 in southern Lebanon. [Archived](https://web.archive.org/web/20241004223919/https://www.aljazeera.com/news/liveblog/2024/10/1/israel-attacks-lebanon-live-israelis-launch-ground-operation-in-lebanon?update=3213138)
     from the original on 4 October 2024. [Archived](https://web.archive.org/web/20241004230027/https://www.aljazeera.com/news/liveblog/2024/10/1/israel-attacks-lebanon-live-israelis-launch-ground-operation-in-lebanon?update=3214633)
     from the original on 4 October 2024. [Archived](https://web.archive.org/web/20241004230018/https://www.aljazeera.com/news/liveblog/2024/10/1/israel-attacks-lebanon-live-israelis-launch-ground-operation-in-lebanon?update=3214749)
     from the original on 4 October 2024."

SummarizeSummariesPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You just retrieved web sources, each one summarized under "Web Sources". **Your task right now is to summarize the web source summaries.**

Always adhere to the following rules:
* Write only one to two paragraphs.
* Include all URLs from the listed sources. Format them as Markdown hyperlinks.
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the summaries.
* Include references (<image:k>) to all relevant images.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:10230> This image shows an Israeli attack on Lebanon on October 21, 2024."

## Actions
```
web_search("Israeli attack Lebanon October 21 2024")
reverse_search(<image:10230>)
```

## Web Sources
**Web Search Result**

From [Source](https://www.cnn.com/world/live-news/israel-iran-lebanon-gaza-war-10-21-24-intl-hnk): 
Content: The CNN article, updated on October 22, 2024, reports on the ongoing conflict between Israel and Hezbollah, including attacks in Lebanon. <image:10230> shows an Israeli attack in Beirut on October 21. The article also mentions an Israeli strike near Rafik Hariri University Hospital, which resulted in casualties. The article also discusses the US's role in the conflict, including Secretary of State Antony Blinken's trip to the Middle East and the US's concerns about the leak of classified intelligence.


From [Source](https://www.npr.org/2024/10/21/nx-s1-5159600/israel-strikes-hezbollah-banks-al-qard-al-hassan): 
Content: The NPR article, published on October 21, 2024, reports on Israeli airstrikes on targets in Lebanon, specifically targeting financial institutions linked to Hezbollah. <image:11584> The article mentions that the strikes occurred overnight and that Lebanon is assessing the damage. The article also mentions that the strikes resulted in casualties. The article is written by Daniel Estrin, Arezou Rezvani, and Willem Marx.


From [Source](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_Israeli_invasion_of_Lebanon):

SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background. 

# Example 2
NONE

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:10230> This image shows an Israeli attack on Lebanon on October 21, 2024."

```
web_search("Israeli attack Lebanon October 21 2024")
reverse_search(<image:10230>)
```

Expert explains why people in central Israel can hear Gaza bombings
===================================================================

Israeli physicist explains how cooler ground temperatures and sound wave refraction amplify blast noise over 40km, detailing atmospheric physics behind military operations’ audible reach
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[Yogev Israeli](https://www.ynetnews.com/topics/Yogev_Israeli "Yogev Israeli")
|

Add a comment

Print[Find an error? Report us](//ynet.co.il/redmail?notifyMistake=rkpd0fkzge "Find an error? Report us")

In recent days, residents across central Israel have reported hearing loud nighttime explosions, likely stemming from [IDF operations in Gaza](https://www.ynetnews.com/article/b1niijygxg)
.

Ynet received dozens of emails from residents describing what sounded like distant blasts. While the IDF has not yet commented, a physicist explained why such explosions can sometimes be heard dozens of kilometers away.

2 View gallery

![לפי דיווחים פלסטינים: צה"ל תוקף אוויריות את ארגון הטרור חמאס ברצועת עזה](https://ynet-pic1.yit.co.il/cdn-cgi/image/format=auto/picserver6/crop_images/2023/10/23/ryejRUO7fp/ryejRUO7fp_0_32_720_406_0_x-large.jpg "IDF strikes in Gaza  ")![לפי דיווחים פלסטינים: צה"ל תוקף אוויריות את ארגון הטרור חמאס ברצועת עזה](https://ynet-pic1.yit.co.il/cdn-cgi/image/format=auto/picserver6/crop_images/2023/10/23/ryejRUO7fp/ryejRUO7fp_0_32_720_406_0_x-large.jpg "IDF strikes in Gaza  ")

IDF strikes in Gaza

Dr. Yuval Rosenberg, a physicist at the [Davidson Institute of Science Education](https://www.ynetnews.com/topics/Davidson_Institute_of_Science)
, told Ynet that weather plays a key role in how sound travels. “When the air gets warmer closer to the ground—usually because the sun heats the surface—sound waves can bend upward, away from our ears, weakening the noise we hear,” he said.

Conversely, during the night, the ground cools faster than the air above it, reversing the effect. “This is one reason why explosions from Gaza often sound louder in central Israel at night,” Rosenberg noted.

2 View gallery

![תקיפה בעזה](https://ynet-pic1.yit.co.il/cdn-cgi/image/format=auto/picserver6/crop_images/2025/05/30/SJlRuOmPzlg/SJlRuOmPzlg_0_0_3000_1688_0_x-large.jpg "IDF strikes in Gaza  (Photo: AP Photo/Jehad Alshrafi) ")![תקיפה בעזה](https://ynet-pic1.yit.co.il/cdn-cgi/image/format=auto/picserver6/crop_images/2025/05/30/SJlRuOmPzlg/SJlRuOmPzlg_0_0_3000_1688_0_x-large.jpg "IDF strikes in Gaza  (Photo: AP Photo/Jehad Alshrafi) ")

IDF strikes in Gaza

(Photo: AP Photo/Jehad Alshrafi)

Get the Ynetnews app on your smartphone: Google Play: [https://bit.ly/4eJ37pE](https://bit.ly/4eJ37pE)
 | Apple App Store: [https://bit.ly/3ZL7iNv](https://bit.ly/3ZL7iNv)

He also explained the physics behind the sound of rocket blasts over the sea. “When a rocket explodes, it produces a shock wave with a sudden and intense air pressure change,” he said. “Close to the blast, this wave can be deadly or cause serious damage—especially in the sea, where it can harm marine life.”

As the shock wave travels, it loses energy by heating the air and interacting with objects. Eventually, it breaks apart into the sound waves we hear. “It’s like a huge wave at sea that collapses into smaller ones,” Rosenberg said.

 | [Telegram](https://t.me/ynetnewslatest)

Hello, I write to you as a member of Amnesty International USA with deep concern over the ongoing violence in the Occupied Palestinian Territory and Israel. I am also deeply worried about President Trump's dangerous threats to forcibly deport around 2 million Palestinians and "take over" the occupied Gaza Strip – as they are not just outrageous and shameful, but if enacted, would amount to a war crime. The U.S. government is uniquely positioned to have tremendous impact in this conflict to ensure the protection of civilians and prevent further suffering. Since the Hamas-led attacks and atrocities on October 7, we have witnessed horror unfolding on an unimaginable scale in the occupied Gaza Strip. More than 2 million Palestinians in Gaza are struggling to survive amidst a human-made humanitarian catastrophe, and the level of civilian casualties has been unprecedented. Amnesty International's new research report, published on December 5 and titled 'You Feel Like You Are Subhuman': Israel's Genocide Against Palestinians in Gaza,' concludes that the Israeli government has committed and is continuing to commit genocide against Palestinians in Gaza. Even with the ceasefire, the Israeli authorities continue to inflict conditions of life calculated to bring about the physical destruction of Palestinians in Gaza, a prohibited act of genocide. I am urging you to immediately suspend the direct and indirect supply, sale, or transfer to the Israeli government of all weapons, munitions, and other military and security equipment that would more likely than not be used in the violation of international humanitarian and human rights law, consistent with the United States’ own laws and its obligations under the Genocide Convention. Governments – including and especially the United States’ – that continue to transfer arms to Israel at this time must know they are violating their obligation to prevent genocide and are at risk of becoming complicit in genocide. To protect civilians, I am also urging you to ensure that the ceasefire becomes permanent and that desperately needed humanitarian aid and reconstruction is not used as a means to coerce Palestinians into leaving Gaza. Palestinians must be allowed to return to their homes and be provided dignified temporary housing until reconstruction is completed. DevelopPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You just retrieved new Evidence. Now, **analyze the Claim's veracity using the evidence**. Always adhere to the following rules:
* Focus on developing new insights. Do not repeat larger parts from the Record. Do not restate the Claim.
* Write down your thoughts step-by-step. Whenever necessary, you may elaborate in more detail.
* Depending on the topic's complexity, invest one to three paragraphs. The fewer, the better.
* If you find that there is insufficient information to verify the Claim, explicitly state what information is missing.
* If you cite web sources, always refer to them by including their URL as a Markdown hyperlink.
* **Use information only from the recorded evidence**: Avoid inserting information that is not implied by the evidence. You may use commonsense knowledge, though.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:10230> This image shows an Israeli attack on Lebanon on October 21, 2024."

## Actions
```
web_search("Israeli attack Lebanon October 21 2024")
reverse_search(<image:10230>)
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
The CNN article ([https://www.cnn.com/world/live-news/israel-iran-lebanon-gaza-war-10-21-24-intl-hnk](https://www.cnn.com/world/live-news/israel-iran-lebanon-gaza-war-10-21-24-intl-hnk)) reports on the ongoing conflict, including an Israeli attack in Beirut on October 21, 2024, and an Israeli strike near Rafik Hariri University Hospital. The NPR article ([https://www.npr.org/2024/10/21/nx-s1-5159600/israel-strikes-hezbollah-banks-al-qard-al-hassan](https://www.npr.org/2024/10/21/nx-s1-5159600/israel-strikes-hezbollah-banks-al-qard-al-hassan)) reports on Israeli airstrikes on financial institutions linked to Hezbollah on October 21, 2024. The Wikipedia article ([https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_Israeli_invasion_of_Lebanon](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_Israeli_invasion_of_Lebanon)) discusses the 2024 Israeli invasion of Lebanon, which began on October 1, 2024, and the resulting conflict. <image:10230>

# Your Analysis



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The CNN article ([https://www.cnn.com/world/live-news/israel-iran-lebanon-gaza-war-10-21-24-intl-hnk](https://www.cnn.com/world/live-news/israel-iran-lebanon-gaza-war-10-21-24-intl-hnk)) confirms that there was an Israeli attack in Beirut on October 21, 2024. The NPR article ([https://www.npr.org/2024/10/21/nx-s1-5159600/israel-strikes-hezbollah-banks-al-qard-al-hassan](https://www.npr.org/2024/10/21/nx-s1-5159600/israel-strikes-hezbollah-banks-al-qard-al-hassan)) also supports this, reporting on Israeli airstrikes on the same date.

The evidence supports the claim that there was an Israeli attack on Lebanon on October 21, 2024. However, the evidence does not confirm that the image depicts this specific attack.

I need more information to verify if the image depicts the Israeli attack on Lebanon on October 21, 2024.

JudgePrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
**Determine the Claim's veracity** by following these steps:
1. Briefly summarize the key insights from the fact-check (see Record) in at most one paragraph.
2. Write one paragraph about which one of the Decision Options applies best. Include the most appropriate decision option at the end and enclose it in backticks like `this`.




## Decision Options
* `not enough information`: The fact-check does not contain sufficient information to come to an conclusion. For example,there is substantial lack of evidence or the evidence is inconclusive, conflicting or self-contradictory. In the case of a lack of evidence, state which information exactly is missing. In particular, if no RESULTS or sources are available, pick this decision.
* `false`: The claim is not factually accurate. This is the case if one of the following three conditions is met:(1) The claim is demonstrably false when it is disproven by evidence from multiple and reliable sources,(2) The claim or image is taken out of context, i.e. the origin, content and/or meaning of a statement or an image is misrepresented. For example, an old claim or an old image is mispresented in a new context in a misleading way,(3) There is not enough evidence to verify the claim or the evidence is conflicting or self-contradictory.
* `true`: The claim is factually accurate when it is confirmed by evidence from multiple and reliable sources.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:10230> This image shows an Israeli attack on Lebanon on October 21, 2024."

## Actions
```
web_search("Israeli attack Lebanon October 21 2024")
reverse_search(<image:10230>)
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
The CNN article ([https://www.cnn.com/world/live-news/israel-iran-lebanon-gaza-war-10-21-24-intl-hnk](https://www.cnn.com/world/live-news/israel-iran-lebanon-gaza-war-10-21-24-intl-hnk)) reports on the ongoing conflict, including an Israeli attack in Beirut on October 21, 2024, and an Israeli strike near Rafik Hariri University Hospital. The NPR article ([https://www.npr.org/2024/10/21/nx-s1-5159600/israel-strikes-hezbollah-banks-al-qard-al-hassan](https://www.npr.org/2024/10/21/nx-s1-5159600/israel-strikes-hezbollah-banks-al-qard-al-hassan)) reports on Israeli airstrikes on financial institutions linked to Hezbollah on October 21, 2024. The Wikipedia article ([https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_Israeli_invasion_of_Lebanon](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_Israeli_invasion_of_Lebanon)) discusses the 2024 Israeli invasion of Lebanon, which began on October 1, 2024, and the resulting conflict. <image:10230>


### Evidence from `reverse_search`
The image <image:10230>

## Elaboration
The CNN article ([https://www.cnn.com/world/live-news/israel-iran-lebanon-gaza-war-10-21-24-intl-hnk](https://www.cnn.com/world/live-news/israel-iran-lebanon-gaza-war-10-21-24-intl-hnk)) confirms that there was an Israeli attack in Beirut on October 21, 2024. The NPR article ([https://www.npr.org/2024/10/21/nx-s1-5159600/israel-strikes-hezbollah-banks-al-qard-al-hassan](https://www.npr.org/2024/10/21/nx-s1-5159600/israel-strikes-hezbollah-banks-al-qard-al-hassan)) also supports this, reporting on Israeli airstrikes on the same date.

The evidence supports the claim that there was an Israeli attack on Lebanon on October 21, 2024. However, the evidence does not confirm that the image depicts this specific attack.

I need more information to verify if the image depicts the Israeli attack on Lebanon on October 21, 2024.


# Your Judgement



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The search results confirm that there were Israeli attacks in Lebanon on October 21, 2024. However, the provided evidence does not confirm that the image depicts this specific event.

`not enough information`
_________________________



PlanPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
The available knowledge is insufficient to assess the Claim. Therefore, **propose a set of actions** to retrieve new and helpful evidence. Adhere to the following rules:
* The actions available are listed under Valid Actions, including a short description for each action. No other actions are possible at this moment. 
* For each action, use the formatting as specified in Valid Actions.
* Include all actions in a single Markdown code block at the end of your answer.
* Propose as few actions as possible, but as much as needed. Do not propose similar or previously used actions.



## Valid Actions
* `web_search`
   * Description: Run an open web search on Google or DuckDuckGO to retrieve any related webpage.
   * How to use: Do not use this with a previously used or similar query from previous web searches. If a previous web search did not yield any results, use a very different query.
   * Format: web_search("your web search query goes here")

* `geolocate`
   * Description: Performs geolocation to determine the country where an image was taken.
   * How to use: Provide an image and the model will determine the most likely countries where it was taken.
   * Format: geolocate(<image:k>), where `k` is the image's ID

# Example: web_search()

## Claim
Text: "New Zealand’s new Food Bill bans gardening"
Claim date: October 29, 2020

...

## Actions
```
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill 2020")
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill gardening ban")
```

# Example: geolocate()

## Claim
Text: "<image:k> shows a nuclear weapons facility in Usbekistan."

...

## Actions
```
geolocate(<image:k>)
```

SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background. 

# Example 2
NONE

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

# Search Result
From [Source](https://www.aljazeera.com/gallery/2024/10/23/images-capture-exact-moment-israeli-missile-hit-building-in-beirut): 
Content: "In Pictures

![Images capture exact moments an Israeli missile strikes building in Beirut](/wp-content/uploads/2024/10/AP24296447205904-1729662348.jpg?resize=1170%2C780&quality=80)

An Israeli missile hits a building in Ghobeiry, Beirut. Another captured it a fragment of a second before it smashed through a lower-floor balcony.

In the images that followed, a cloud of smoke and debris billowed outwards as the building collapsed.

![Images capture exact moments an Israeli missile strikes building in Beirut](/wp-content/uploads/2024/10/AP24296562863883-1729663333.jpg?fit=1170%2C780&quality=80)

Smoke rises from the building following an Israeli warning strike that came minutes before a missile brought down the building. \[Bilal Hussein/AP Photo\]

![Images capture exact moments an Israeli missile strikes building in Beirut](/wp-content/uploads/2024/10/AP24296451292047-1729662390.jpg?fit=1170%2C780&quality=80)

The strike on Tuesday came roughly 40 minutes after an Israeli military spokesperson posted a warning on social media, notifying people in and around a pair of buildings in Beirut’s southern suburbs to evacuate the area. \[Bilal Hussein/AP Photo\]

![Images capture exact moments an Israeli missile strikes building in Beirut](/wp-content/uploads/2024/10/AP24296455928781-1729662416.jpg?fit=1170%2C780&quality=80)

People duck as the missile hits the building in Ghobeiry. \[Bilal Hussein/AP Photo\]

![Images capture exact moments an Israeli missile strikes building in Beirut](/wp-content/uploads/2024/10/AP24296474230767-1729662459.jpg?fit=1170%2C780&quality=80)

People watch the building collapse. \[Bilal Hussein/AP Photo\]

![Images capture exact moments an Israeli missile strikes building in Beirut](/wp-content/uploads/2024/10/AP24296450541455-1729662370.jpg?fit=1170%2C780&quality=80)

Smoke rises from the destroyed building in the densely populated neighbourhood. \[Bilal Hussein/AP Photo\]

![Images capture exact moments an Israeli missile strikes building in Beirut](/wp-content/uploads/2024/10/AP24296464224394-1729662438.jpg?fit=1170%2C780&quality=80)

Clouds of smoke and debris billow as the structure collapses. \[Bilal Hussein/AP Photo\]

![Images capture exact moments an Israeli missile strikes building in Beirut](/wp-content/uploads/2024/10/AP24296567257612-1729662485.jpg?fit=1170%2C780&quality=80)

A flock of birds fly over the building minutes before the Israeli air strike. \[Bilal Hussein/AP Photo\]

Published On 23 Oct 202423 Oct 2024

Taking cover behind a large tree, a photographer from The Associated Press news agency pointed his camera towards an apartment building in Beirut that the Israeli military warned was in its sights.

When a missile plunged from the sky moments later, the photojournalist and his lens were perfectly positioned to document the trail of destruction – second by second, frame by frame.

“I heard the sound of the missile whistling, headed toward the building and then I started filming,” photographer Bilal Hussein said on Tuesday, hours after Israeli forces launched the attack. The images Hussein captured of the projectile, frozen in mid-flight before obliterating the structure, provide a striking look at the speed, power and devastation of modern warfare.

The strike on Tuesday came roughly 40 minutes after an Israeli military spokesperson posted a warning in Arabic on social media, notifying people in and around a pair of buildings in the southern suburbs of the Lebanese capital that they should evacuate the area.

He did not explain why the buildings were being targeted, other than to say they were near “interests and facilities” associated with the Hezbollah group.

The warning prompted many people to flee the busy, densely populated neighbourhood, even as others, including a few journalists, kept watch."

The article includes images of the strike and the building's collapse. <image:1>, <image:2>, <image:3>, <image:4>, <image:5>, <image:6>, <image:7>, <image:8>.

[World News](https://apnews.com/world-news)

Images capture the exact moments an Israeli bomb strikes a building in Beirut
=============================================================================

             ![CAPTION CORRECTS TYPE OF MUNITION A bomb dropped from an Israeli jet hits a building in Ghobeiri, Beirut, Lebanon, Tuesday, Oct. In the images that followed, a cloud of smoke and debris billowed outward as the building collapsed.

Hussein, who has spent years covering conflicts in Iraq and Lebanon since joining the AP in 2004, says he has become accustomed to the sounds of explosions. (AP Photo/Bilal Hussein)](https://dims.apnews.com/dims4/default/317fdc3/2147483647/strip/true/crop/8640x5751+0+5/resize/320x213!/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fassets.apnews.com%2F47%2Fc3%2F91dd04274238ddefcfbead6b2a91%2Fa62c579034fb429fba04d1c7d888df28)

A bomb dropped from an Israeli jet hits a building in Ghobeiri, Beirut, Lebanon, Tuesday, Oct. The images Hussein captured of the projectile, frozen in mid-flight before obliterating the structure, provide a striking look at the speed, power and devastation of modern warfare.

The strike Tuesday came roughly 40 minutes after an Israeli military spokesperson posted a warning in Arabic on social media, notifying people in and around a pair of buildings on [Beirut’s southern outskirts](https://apnews.com/article/lebanon-strike-hospital-israel-rescue-survivors-rubble-da09186fc06d734e0457e6c099f3d992)
 that that they should evacuate the area.

        ![CAPTION CORRECTS TYPE OF MUNITION A bomb dropped from an Israeli jet hits a building in Ghobeiri, Beirut, Lebanon, Tuesday, Oct. (AP Photo/Bilal Hussein)](https://dims.apnews.com/dims4/default/8121765/2147483647/strip/true/crop/8640x5760+0+0/resize/599x399!/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fassets.apnews.com%2Fad%2F5a%2Fba7904302b111be51cfd30ac439c%2F5eea8419f4414c248a71b352ab70fe88)

A bomb dropped from an Israeli jet hits a building in Ghobeiri, Beirut, Lebanon, Tuesday, Oct. (AP Photo/Bilal Hussein)](https://dims.apnews.com/dims4/default/f105597/2147483647/strip/true/crop/8640x5760+0+0/resize/599x399!/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fassets.apnews.com%2F1e%2F17%2F61b02b5fade3ce1f794b0a52a23f%2F6e1bd926a346420fbf9de63c8542f0bb)

People duck down as a bomb dropped from an Israeli jet hits a building in Ghobeiri, Beirut, Lebanon, Tuesday, Oct. (AP Photo/Bilal Hussein)](https://dims.apnews.com/dims4/default/65a1136/2147483647/strip/true/crop/8640x5760+0+0/resize/599x399!/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fassets.apnews.com%2F8b%2F73%2F3331bb74bb0b120924a35e777fb0%2Fc879e0cba4d543879bbb24ec70514170)

(AP Photo/Bilal Hussein)](https://dims.apnews.com/dims4/default/404e09b/2147483647/strip/true/crop/8640x5760+0+0/resize/599x399!/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fassets.apnews.com%2F5e%2Fa3%2F56e8a48940e0fc88b6bd8381ce2a%2Fb3c92e89bdae445c96aed573bcbf5526)

(AP Photo/Bilal Hussein)](https://dims.apnews.com/dims4/default/4e7e307/2147483647/strip/true/crop/8640x5760+0+0/resize/599x399!/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fassets.apnews.com%2Fca%2F32%2Fa1291237878582f5b8f4139cd051%2F3e5145f4c17a48f7b108c3aa5caea600)

Smoke rises from a building that was hit by an Israeli airstrike in Ghobeiri, Beirut, Lebanon, Tuesday, Oct."

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The AP News article, published on October 22, 2024, features images of an Israeli airstrike on a building in Ghobeiri, Beirut, Lebanon, on Tuesday, October 22, 2024. <image:10230> is not in the article. The article includes multiple images of the strike.

SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background. 

# Example 2
NONE

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:10230> This image shows an Israeli attack on Lebanon on October 21, 2024."

## Actions
```
web_search("Israeli attack Lebanon October 21 2024")
reverse_search(<image:10230>)
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
The CNN article ([https://www.cnn.com/world/live-news/israel-iran-lebanon-gaza-war-10-21-24-intl-hnk](https://www.cnn.com/world/live-news/israel-iran-lebanon-gaza-war-10-21-24-intl-hnk)) reports on the ongoing conflict, including an Israeli attack in Beirut on October 21, 2024, and an Israeli strike near Rafik Hariri University Hospital. The NPR article ([https://www.npr.org/2024/10/21/nx-s1-5159600/israel-strikes-hezbollah-banks-al-qard-al-hassan](https://www.npr.org/2024/10/21/nx-s1-5159600/israel-strikes-hezbollah-banks-al-qard-al-hassan)) reports on Israeli airstrikes on financial institutions linked to Hezbollah on October 21, 2024. The Wikipedia article ([https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_Israeli_invasion_of_Lebanon](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_Israeli_invasion_of_Lebanon)) discusses the 2024 Israeli invasion of Lebanon, which began on October 1, 2024, and the resulting conflict. <image:10230>


### Evidence from `reverse_search`
The image <image:10230>

## Elaboration
The CNN article ([https://www.cnn.com/world/live-news/israel-iran-lebanon-gaza-war-10-21-24-intl-hnk](https://www.cnn.com/world/live-news/israel-iran-lebanon-gaza-war-10-21-24-intl-hnk)) confirms that there was an Israeli attack in Beirut on October 21, 2024. The NPR article ([https://www.npr.org/2024/10/21/nx-s1-5159600/israel-strikes-hezbollah-banks-al-qard-al-hassan](https://www.npr.org/2024/10/21/nx-s1-5159600/israel-strikes-hezbollah-banks-al-qard-al-hassan)) also supports this, reporting on Israeli airstrikes on the same date.

The evidence supports the claim that there was an Israeli attack on Lebanon on October 21, 2024. However, the evidence does not confirm that the image depicts this specific attack.

I need more information to verify if the image depicts the Israeli attack on Lebanon on October 21, 2024.


## Actions
```
web_search("image explosion building lebanon october 21 2024")
```

Even before the ground invasion, months of rocket strikes had damaged Yaroun, this satellite imagery from the summer shows.

But the new satellite imagery shows fresh destruction since the invasion, with a whole section of Yaroun flattened after Israeli military vehicles razed the area.

After a week of shelling, strikes and clearing, there are more visibly destroyed buildings than previously seen. 5

MAROUN AL-RAS

Flattened area

Maroun al-Ras has seen fighting before: It was the scene of a major battle during Israel’s 2006 invasion of Lebanon. Scores of homes leveled, a damaged health clinic and a centuries-old mosque now little more than rubble — toppled, a video suggests, in what appears to be a controlled explosion by the Israeli military.

These are some of the first glimpses to emerge from southern Lebanon, a week after Israel began its ground invasion there as part of its multipronged fight against Hezbollah. So are newly constructed banks of earth where the Israeli military set up positions for tanks and other military vehicles.

Over the past week, the Israeli military has flattened large parts of two border villages: Maroun al-Ras and Yaroun, seen in the video above that was filmed by the Israeli military and verified by The Times.

Hezbollah has been launching rockets aimed at Israel from southern Lebanon since last October in solidarity with Hamas. Hezbollah says it has targeted Israeli troops in both Maroun al-Ras and Yaroun with rocket barrages.

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The New York Times published an article on October 9, 2024, discussing the destruction in Lebanon. The article includes satellite imagery from Planet Labs, dated October 28, 2024, showing flattened buildings in Yaroun and Maroun al-Ras. The article also mentions the Israeli military's actions, including flattening areas and setting up positions. <image:10230>

SummarizeSummariesPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You just retrieved web sources, each one summarized under "Web Sources". **Your task right now is to summarize the web source summaries.**

Always adhere to the following rules:
* Write only one to two paragraphs.
* Include all URLs from the listed sources. Format them as Markdown hyperlinks.
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the summaries.
* Include references (<image:k>) to all relevant images.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:10230> This image shows an Israeli attack on Lebanon on October 21, 2024."

The AP News article, published on October 22, 2024, features images of an Israeli airstrike on a building in Ghobeiri, Beirut, Lebanon, on Tuesday, October 22, 2024. DevelopPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You just retrieved new Evidence. Now, **analyze the Claim's veracity using the evidence**. Always adhere to the following rules:
* Focus on developing new insights. Do not repeat larger parts from the Record. Do not restate the Claim.
* Write down your thoughts step-by-step. Whenever necessary, you may elaborate in more detail.
* Depending on the topic's complexity, invest one to three paragraphs. The fewer, the better.
* If you find that there is insufficient information to verify the Claim, explicitly state what information is missing.
* If you cite web sources, always refer to them by including their URL as a Markdown hyperlink.
* **Use information only from the recorded evidence**: Avoid inserting information that is not implied by the evidence. You may use commonsense knowledge, though.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:10230> This image shows an Israeli attack on Lebanon on October 21, 2024."

## Actions
```
web_search("Israeli attack Lebanon October 21 2024")
reverse_search(<image:10230>)
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
The CNN article ([https://www.cnn.com/world/live-news/israel-iran-lebanon-gaza-war-10-21-24-intl-hnk](https://www.cnn.com/world/live-news/israel-iran-lebanon-gaza-war-10-21-24-intl-hnk)) reports on the ongoing conflict, including an Israeli attack in Beirut on October 21, 2024, and an Israeli strike near Rafik Hariri University Hospital. The NPR article ([https://www.npr.org/2024/10/21/nx-s1-5159600/israel-strikes-hezbollah-banks-al-qard-al-hassan](https://www.npr.org/2024/10/21/nx-s1-5159600/israel-strikes-hezbollah-banks-al-qard-al-hassan)) reports on Israeli airstrikes on financial institutions linked to Hezbollah on October 21, 2024. The Wikipedia article ([https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_Israeli_invasion_of_Lebanon](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_Israeli_invasion_of_Lebanon)) discusses the 2024 Israeli invasion of Lebanon, which began on October 1, 2024, and the resulting conflict. <image:10230>


### Evidence from `reverse_search`
The image <image:10230>

## Elaboration
The CNN article ([https://www.cnn.com/world/live-news/israel-iran-lebanon-gaza-war-10-21-24-intl-hnk](https://www.cnn.com/world/live-news/israel-iran-lebanon-gaza-war-10-21-24-intl-hnk)) confirms that there was an Israeli attack in Beirut on October 21, 2024. The NPR article ([https://www.npr.org/2024/10/21/nx-s1-5159600/israel-strikes-hezbollah-banks-al-qard-al-hassan](https://www.npr.org/2024/10/21/nx-s1-5159600/israel-strikes-hezbollah-banks-al-qard-al-hassan)) also supports this, reporting on Israeli airstrikes on the same date.

The evidence supports the claim that there was an Israeli attack on Lebanon on October 21, 2024. However, the evidence does not confirm that the image depicts this specific attack.

I need more information to verify if the image depicts the Israeli attack on Lebanon on October 21, 2024.


## Actions
```
web_search("image explosion building lebanon october 21 2024")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
Al Jazeera published an article on October 23, 2024, with images of an Israeli missile strike on a building in Beirut on October 22, 2024 (<image:1>, <image:2>, <image:3>, <image:4>, <image:5>, <image:6>, <image:7>, <image:8>). The AP News article, published on October 22, 2024, features images of an Israeli airstrike on a building in Ghobeiri, Beirut, Lebanon, on Tuesday, October 22, 2024. The New York Times published an article on October 9, 2024, discussing the destruction in Lebanon, including satellite imagery from Planet Labs, dated October 28, 2024. The image <image:10230>

# Your Analysis



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The evidence indicates that there were Israeli attacks in Lebanon on October 21 and 22, 2024. However, the search results do not provide any information to confirm whether the image depicts an attack on October 21, 2024. The image could depict the attack on October 22, 2024, but this cannot be confirmed.

I need more information to verify if the image depicts the Israeli attack on Lebanon on October 21, 2024.

_________________________



JudgePrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
**Determine the Claim's veracity** by following these steps:
1. Briefly summarize the key insights from the fact-check (see Record) in at most one paragraph.
2. Write one paragraph about which one of the Decision Options applies best. Include the most appropriate decision option at the end and enclose it in backticks like `this`.




## Decision Options
* `not enough information`: The fact-check does not contain sufficient information to come to an conclusion. For example,there is substantial lack of evidence or the evidence is inconclusive, conflicting or self-contradictory. In the case of a lack of evidence, state which information exactly is missing. In particular, if no RESULTS or sources are available, pick this decision.
* `false`: The claim is not factually accurate. This is the case if one of the following three conditions is met:(1) The claim is demonstrably false when it is disproven by evidence from multiple and reliable sources,(2) The claim or image is taken out of context, i.e. the origin, content and/or meaning of a statement or an image is misrepresented. For example, an old claim or an old image is mispresented in a new context in a misleading way,(3) There is not enough evidence to verify the claim or the evidence is conflicting or self-contradictory.
* `true`: The claim is factually accurate when it is confirmed by evidence from multiple and reliable sources.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:10230> This image shows an Israeli attack on Lebanon on October 21, 2024."

## Actions
```
web_search("Israeli attack Lebanon October 21 2024")
reverse_search(<image:10230>)
```

## Evidence

The CNN article ([https://www.cnn.com/world/live-news/israel-iran-lebanon-gaza-war-10-21-24-intl-hnk](https://www.cnn.com/world/live-news/israel-iran-lebanon-gaza-war-10-21-24-intl-hnk)) reports on the ongoing conflict, including an Israeli attack in Beirut on October 21, 2024, and an Israeli strike near Rafik Hariri University Hospital. The NPR article ([https://www.npr.org/2024/10/21/nx-s1-5159600/israel-strikes-hezbollah-banks-al-qard-al-hassan](https://www.npr.org/2024/10/21/nx-s1-5159600/israel-strikes-hezbollah-banks-al-qard-al-hassan)) reports on Israeli airstrikes on financial institutions linked to Hezbollah on October 21, 2024. The Wikipedia article ([https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_Israeli_invasion_of_Lebanon](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_Israeli_invasion_of_Lebanon)) discusses the 2024 Israeli invasion of Lebanon, which began on October 1, 2024, and the resulting conflict. <image:10230>

## Elaboration
The evidence indicates that there were Israeli attacks in Lebanon on October 21 and 22, 2024. However, the search results do not provide any information to confirm whether the image depicts an attack on October 21, 2024. The image could depict the attack on October 22, 2024, but this cannot be confirmed.

I need more information to verify if the image depicts the Israeli attack on Lebanon on October 21, 2024.


# Your Judgement



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The provided evidence confirms that there were Israeli attacks in Lebanon on October 21, 2024. However, the search results do not provide any information to confirm whether the image depicts an attack on October 21, 2024.

`not enough information`

_________________________



PlanPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
The available knowledge is insufficient to assess the Claim. Therefore, **propose a set of actions** to retrieve new and helpful evidence. Adhere to the following rules:
* The actions available are listed under Valid Actions, including a short description for each action. No other actions are possible at this moment. 
* For each action, use the formatting as specified in Valid Actions.
* Include all actions in a single Markdown code block at the end of your answer.
* Propose as few actions as possible, but as much as needed. Do not propose similar or previously used actions.



## Valid Actions
* `web_search`
   * Description: Run an open web search on Google or DuckDuckGO to retrieve any related webpage.
   * How to use: Do not use this with a previously used or similar query from previous web searches. If a previous web search did not yield any results, use a very different query.
   * Format: web_search("your web search query goes here")

* `geolocate`
   * Description: Performs geolocation to determine the country where an image was taken.
   * How to use: Provide an image and the model will determine the most likely countries where it was taken.
   * Format: geolocate(<image:k>), where `k` is the image's ID

# Example: web_search()

## Claim
Text: "New Zealand’s new Food Bill bans gardening"
Claim date: October 29, 2020

...

## Actions
```
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill 2020")
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill gardening ban")
```

# Example: geolocate()

## Claim
Text: "<image:k> shows a nuclear weapons facility in Usbekistan."

...

## Actions
```
geolocate(<image:k>)
```

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:10230> This image shows an Israeli attack on Lebanon on October 21, 2024."

## Actions
```
web_search("Israeli attack Lebanon October 21 2024")
reverse_search(<image:10230>)
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
The CNN article ([https://www.cnn.com/world/live-news/israel-iran-lebanon-gaza-war-10-21-24-intl-hnk](https://www.cnn.com/world/live-news/israel-iran-lebanon-gaza-war-10-21-24-intl-hnk)) reports on the ongoing conflict, including an Israeli attack in Beirut on October 21, 2024, and an Israeli strike near Rafik Hariri University Hospital. The NPR article ([https://www.npr.org/2024/10/21/nx-s1-5159600/israel-strikes-hezbollah-banks-al-qard-al-hassan](https://www.npr.org/2024/10/21/nx-s1-5159600/israel-strikes-hezbollah-banks-al-qard-al-hassan)) reports on Israeli airstrikes on financial institutions linked to Hezbollah on October 21, 2024. The Wikipedia article ([https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_Israeli_invasion_of_Lebanon](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_Israeli_invasion_of_Lebanon)) discusses the 2024 Israeli invasion of Lebanon, which began on October 1, 2024, and the resulting conflict. <image:10230>


### Evidence from `reverse_search`
The image <image:10230>

## Elaboration
The CNN article ([https://www.cnn.com/world/live-news/israel-iran-lebanon-gaza-war-10-21-24-intl-hnk](https://www.cnn.com/world/live-news/israel-iran-lebanon-gaza-war-10-21-24-intl-hnk)) confirms that there was an Israeli attack in Beirut on October 21, 2024. The NPR article ([https://www.npr.org/2024/10/21/nx-s1-5159600/israel-strikes-hezbollah-banks-al-qard-al-hassan](https://www.npr.org/2024/10/21/nx-s1-5159600/israel-strikes-hezbollah-banks-al-qard-al-hassan)) also supports this, reporting on Israeli airstrikes on the same date.

The evidence supports the claim that there was an Israeli attack on Lebanon on October 21, 2024. However, the evidence does not confirm that the image depicts this specific attack.

I need more information to verify if the image depicts the Israeli attack on Lebanon on October 21, 2024.


## Actions
```
web_search("image explosion building lebanon october 21 2024")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`

The AP News article, published on October 22, 2024, features images of an Israeli airstrike on a building in Ghobeiri, Beirut, Lebanon, on Tuesday, October 22, 2024. The New York Times published an article on October 9, 2024, discussing the destruction in Lebanon, including satellite imagery from Planet Labs, dated October 28, 2024. The image <image:10230>

## Elaboration
The evidence indicates that there were Israeli attacks in Lebanon on October 21 and 22, 2024. However, the search results do not provide any information to confirm whether the image depicts an attack on October 21, 2024. The image could depict the attack on October 22, 2024, but this cannot be confirmed.

I need more information to verify if the image depicts the Israeli attack on Lebanon on October 21, 2024.

SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background. 

# Example 2
NONE

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background. 

# Example 2
NONE

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:10230> This image shows an Israeli attack on Lebanon on October 21, 2024."

## Actions
```
web_search("Israeli attack Lebanon October 21 2024")
reverse_search(<image:10230>)
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
The CNN article ([https://www.cnn.com/world/live-news/israel-iran-lebanon-gaza-war-10-21-24-intl-hnk](https://www.cnn.com/world/live-news/israel-iran-lebanon-gaza-war-10-21-24-intl-hnk)) reports on the ongoing conflict, including an Israeli attack in Beirut on October 21, 2024, and an Israeli strike near Rafik Hariri University Hospital. The NPR article ([https://www.npr.org/2024/10/21/nx-s1-5159600/israel-strikes-hezbollah-banks-al-qard-al-hassan](https://www.npr.org/2024/10/21/nx-s1-5159600/israel-strikes-hezbollah-banks-al-qard-al-hassan)) reports on Israeli airstrikes on financial institutions linked to Hezbollah on October 21, 2024. The Wikipedia article ([https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_Israeli_invasion_of_Lebanon](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_Israeli_invasion_of_Lebanon)) discusses the 2024 Israeli invasion of Lebanon, which began on October 1, 2024, and the resulting conflict. <image:10230>


### Evidence from `reverse_search`
The image <image:10230>

## Elaboration
The CNN article ([https://www.cnn.com/world/live-news/israel-iran-lebanon-gaza-war-10-21-24-intl-hnk](https://www.cnn.com/world/live-news/israel-iran-lebanon-gaza-war-10-21-24-intl-hnk)) confirms that there was an Israeli attack in Beirut on October 21, 2024. The NPR article ([https://www.npr.org/2024/10/21/nx-s1-5159600/israel-strikes-hezbollah-banks-al-qard-al-hassan](https://www.npr.org/2024/10/21/nx-s1-5159600/israel-strikes-hezbollah-banks-al-qard-al-hassan)) also supports this, reporting on Israeli airstrikes on the same date.

The evidence supports the claim that there was an Israeli attack on Lebanon on October 21, 2024. However, the evidence does not confirm that the image depicts this specific attack.

I need more information to verify if the image depicts the Israeli attack on Lebanon on October 21, 2024.


## Actions
```
web_search("image explosion building lebanon october 21 2024")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
Al Jazeera published an article on October 23, 2024, with images of an Israeli missile strike on a building in Beirut on October 22, 2024 (<image:1>, <image:2>, <image:3>, <image:4>, <image:5>, <image:6>, <image:7>, <image:8>). The AP News article, published on October 22, 2024, features images of an Israeli airstrike on a building in Ghobeiri, Beirut, Lebanon, on Tuesday, October 22, 2024. The New York Times published an article on October 9, 2024, discussing the destruction in Lebanon, including satellite imagery from Planet Labs, dated October 28, 2024. The image <image:10230>

## Elaboration
The evidence indicates that there were Israeli attacks in Lebanon on October 21 and 22, 2024. However, the search results do not provide any information to confirm whether the image depicts an attack on October 21, 2024. The image could depict the attack on October 22, 2024, but this cannot be confirmed.

I need more information to verify if the image depicts the Israeli attack on Lebanon on October 21, 2024.


## Actions
```
web_search("Getty Images MAHMOD HAMS Israeli attack Lebanon")
```

# Instructions
You just retrieved new Evidence. Now, **analyze the Claim's veracity using the evidence**. Always adhere to the following rules:
* Focus on developing new insights. Do not repeat larger parts from the Record. Do not restate the Claim.
* Write down your thoughts step-by-step. Whenever necessary, you may elaborate in more detail.
* Depending on the topic's complexity, invest one to three paragraphs. The fewer, the better.
* If you find that there is insufficient information to verify the Claim, explicitly state what information is missing.
* If you cite web sources, always refer to them by including their URL as a Markdown hyperlink.
* **Use information only from the recorded evidence**: Avoid inserting information that is not implied by the evidence. You may use commonsense knowledge, though.

JudgePrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
**Determine the Claim's veracity** by following these steps:
1. Briefly summarize the key insights from the fact-check (see Record) in at most one paragraph.
2. Write one paragraph about which one of the Decision Options applies best. Include the most appropriate decision option at the end and enclose it in backticks like `this`.




## Decision Options
* `false`: The claim is not factually accurate. This is the case if one of the following three conditions is met:(1) The claim is demonstrably false when it is disproven by evidence from multiple and reliable sources,(2) The claim or image is taken out of context, i.e. the origin, content and/or meaning of a statement or an image is misrepresented. For example, an old claim or an old image is mispresented in a new context in a misleading way,(3) There is not enough evidence to verify the claim or the evidence is conflicting or self-contradictory.
* `true`: The claim is factually accurate when it is confirmed by evidence from multiple and reliable sources.
